column4: PLEASE HELP: i compiled a program using gcc, its compiled and LINKED, But when i try to do ./programname , i get a "permission denied", then i did "sudo -s ./programname", and i get "cannot execute binary file"
type "file ./programname" -- what does it say?
./cse473-ipc: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), for GNU/Linux 2.6.8, dynamically linked (uses shared libs), not stripped

PLEASE HELP: i compiled a program using gcc, its compiled and LINKED, But when i try to do ./programname , i get a "permission denied", then i did "sudo -s ./programname", and i get "cannot execute binary file"
Well, that certainly seems like it should run.
I know i have no idea wtf is going on :(
What does "ldd ./programname" give you?
could it have anything to do with me using VBOX ?
That I can't answer, since I haven't tried VBox yet.
ldd: warning: you do not have execution permission for `./cse473-ipc'
So, what's "ls -l cse473-ipc" show/
-rw-rw-rw- 1 root root 13584 2009-02-13 00:16 cse473-ipc
Well, then just try "chmod +x cse473-ipc"
Thought I'm not sure why gcc would create it w/o the execute bit on it.
i did that, it doesnt change anything
Try this... copy it to /tmp, then chmod +x it there.
I'm going to take a guess that for some reason, you're on a filesystem mounted with a mask that precludes execute...
nice work lol, i totally forgot that i was working out of my Share folder in Vbox
haha what a dumb move
thanks for the help
np
